intro: Conceveiba maynasensis, commonly known as the Amazonian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by both animals and humans.
